cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 355 miles SSW of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, turning north and then quickly north-northeast across the northern Gulf, expected to cross the Deep South and exit off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (near Morgan City/New Orleans area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Walton/Bay County Line FL; Storm Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL including bays
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast, then inland across Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and the Carolinas into the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible as the center passes inland to the west on Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the South Carolina coast from Zeta
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized higher amounts could cause temporary flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat in rain bands on 29 Oct; elevated river/creek levels could delay cargo movements inland
